What is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning?
options: Supervised learning uses labeled data, unsupervised learning uses unlabeled data
Supervised learning uses unlabeled data, unsupervised learning uses labeled data
Supervised learning is faster than unsupervised learning
Unsupervised learning uses deep learning models
Data Science.answer: Supervised learning uses labeled data, unsupervised learning uses unlabeled data

Data Science.question: What is overfitting in machine learning?
options: Model is too simple to capture the underlying patterns
Model performs well on training data but poorly on test data
Model performs well on test data but poorly on training data
Data Science.answer: Model performs well on training data but poorly on test data

Data Science.question: What is the role of the target variable in supervised learning?

Data Science.answer: It is the output variable the model is trying to predict

AI Engineer.question: What is overfitting in machine learning?
options: When the model learns the details of the training data too well and fails on new data
When the model performs perfectly on the test data
When the model doesn't learn anything
When the model is too simple to make predictions
AI Engineer.answer: When the model learns the details of the training data too well and fails on new data
